Mutators

Using DLPacker based mutators

If you wish to used DLPacker based Mutators (dlp and dlpr), DLPacker weights have to be downloaded. Get them over here or ` here`_. These weights have to be extracted to a dedicated folder and its path has to be specified in the input config under the paths key, on the mutator option.

locuaz.mutators module

locuaz.basemutator module

class locuaz.basemutator.BaseMutator(bin_dir: Path, radius: float = 5)[source]

Bases: object

BaseMutator offers 4 static methods to help development of new mutators: split_solute_solvent(), fix_pdb(), port_mutation() and add_water(). A Mutator may output a PDB that has waters overlapping with the newly mutated residue. :param bin_dir: path to the binary file. :type bin_dir: Path :param radius: radius freesasa will use to define the Ag-Ab interface. Default: 5A. :type radius: float

Raises:

static add_water(solute_path: Path | PDBStructure, solvent_path: Path | PDBStructure, out_path: Path) → PDBStructure[source]
assert_outfile(out_file: str | Path | FileHandle, *, stdout: str, stderr: str, command: str) → Path[source]
static fix_pdb(pdb_in: Path | PDBStructure) → Path[source]

Uses AA_MAP to map non-standard amino acids to standard ones (eg: ‘CY2’ to ‘CYS’) and then removes non-amino acidic molecules (eg: ‘ZN’ and other ligands). This is to prevent mutators from choking on some proteins. :param pdb_in: input dried PDB without water nor ions which may contain non-standard :param residues and non-amino acidic molecules:

Returns:

PDB without non-amino acidic molecules and with standardized resnames

Return type:

Path

on_pdb(input_pdb: PDBStructure, local_dir: Path, *, mutation: Mutation, selection_complex: str | None = None, selection_wations: str | None = None) → PDBStructure[source]
static port_mutation(mutated_pdb: Path | PDBStructure, original_pdb: Path | PDBStructure, mut: Mutation, surrounding_residues: Set[Tuple[int, str, str]] | None = None) → Path[source]
static split_solute_solvent(pdb_in: PDBStructure | Path, *, selection_complex: str | None = None, selection_wations: str | None = None) → Tuple[PDBStructure, PDBStructure][source]

locuaz.mutatordlp module

locuaz.mutatordlpr module

The dlpr mutator uses DLPacker to reorient the side-chains of the residues that are within a certain distance of the mutated position. To adjust this distance use the config['mutation']['reconstruct_radius'] option. Notice that non-standard residues and cysteins that are forming sulfide bridges will be excluded from this reorientation.
